frontmatter.title: Intelligently enforcement of Fine-Grained Access Control for SQL queries

node.html: My proposal for a model-driven methodology for minimizing the performance impact of enforcing FGAC policies using SQLSI on databases.

frontmatter.title: A Model-Driven Approach for Enforcing Fine-Grained Access Control for SQL Queries (extended version)

node.html: A model-based methodology for developing an FGAC-enforcement mechanism following our previous formal characterization, extended with empirical results about the impact in execution-time efficiency.
A case to study the readiness of the state-of-the-art model transformation tools on implementing the transformation from OCL expressions to SQL statements.

frontmatter.title: A Model-Driven Approach for Enforcing Fine-Grained Access Control for SQL Queries

node.html: A model-based methodology for developing an FGAC-enforcement mechanism following our previous formal characterization.

frontmatter.title: Model-based Characterization of fine-grained Access Control Authorization for SQL Queries

node.html: A formal characterization of enforcement of Fine-Grained Access Control (FGAC) policies for a subset of Structure Query Language (SQL) statements.

frontmatter.title: OCL2PSQL: An OCL-to-SQL Code-Generator for Model-Driven Engineering

node.html: A novel formal mappings from the Object Constraint Language (OCL) to the Structure Query Language (SQL) that overcomes some of the limitations of the previous proposed mappings.

frontmatter.title: Mapping OCL into SQL: Challenges and Opportunities Ahead

node.html: A review/discussion, in the light of model-driven engineering, some of the challenges and opportunities of the mapping from the Object Constraint Language (OCL) to the Structure Query Language (SQL).
